project.description:
Aquires all jobs backed up to a github repository
IMPORTANT!!! This is not really a pull, but a fetch followed by a hard reset. If you have made any changes to any jobs, push those first before running this job.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: GITUSER
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: What user are you identifying yourself to git as?

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: REPO
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: What is the url of the git repo where the jenkins jobs are stored?

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: cd /var/jenkins_home/jobs eval `ssh-agent -s` # Add the key to the agent. ssh-add /var/jenkins_ssh/github_id_jenkins_rsa # ssh -T git@github.com if [ ! -d .git ] ; then git init git config user.email "jenkins@bu.edu" git config user.name $GITUSER git remote add github $REPO fi if [ ! -f .gitignore ] ; then echo > .gitignore "# Ignore everything in subdirectories" echo >> .gitignore "/*/*" echo >> .gitignore "# ...except the config.xml file in those subdirectories" echo >> .gitignore "!/**/config.xml" echo >> .gitignore "#...and this file" echo >> .gitignore "!.gitignore" fi if [ -n "$(git status -s -z)" ] ; then echo "FOUND LOCAL CHANGES! SORRY, YOUR ARE GOING TO LOSE THESE." fi echo "Fetching from upstream and performing hard reset" git fetch github master git reset --hard FETCH_HEAD eval `ssh-agent -k`
